sub_title: A professional with strong experience in finance and customer service
summary: When I think of work so far, and what will drive me in the future, three words come to my mind: passion, confidence and strive to be better. I desire to be the person who through passion for work encourages others to be better in what they do, who has confidence that the tasks and projects ahead can be accomplished with benefit to all involved and who believes that the development never ends.

profile_positions.description:
- Operational activities related to RADE process:
	-Control and release of sales orders created by group companies (GCs) incl. relevant internal registration activities. (SAP, Excel)
	- Monthly invoicing check and GL entries (GL reconciliation)
	- Regularly check based on OCEAN query to minimize difference on license fee between monthly order entry and year end statement
	- Year end statements execution, including data gathering from Ocean, communication with group companies, order creation and invoicing, registration in Excel and Anaqua
-	Operational activities related to non-RADE process
	- Accruals: check for correctness and GL entry
	- Yearly invoicing according to license agreement
-	Update and maintain product lists as per license agreement portfolio, communicate updated lists with stakeholders
-	Data and document management in Anaqua IPMS
-	Registration of new agreements in Anaqua IPMS incl. creation of payment schedules 
-	General maintenance in Anaqua IPMS 
-	Follow up tasks from Anaqua IPMS
-	Support ICTP process in the course of new license agreements and ensure ICTP disclosures meet requirement
- Build and maintain a good working relationship with colleagues worldwide
- Follow regulations for environment, health and safety
profile_positions.title: Intellectual Property Officer
Credit Controller

profile_positions.description:
General: To assess and control the level of credit risk on specific remit accounts and to ensure that all customer accounts are accurately and promptly maintained, ensuring the efficient release of orders to maximise sales whilst having regard to the Company credit policy
Main responsibilities:
1. Obtain timely relevant customer and financial data to establish criteria for reviewing and setting new and existing customer credit limits. 
2.Setting up of new customer database and existing customer data changes within JBA.
3.Day to day contact with all relevant/designated outdoor customers and internal coalition divisions to resolve customer queries/issues.
4.Maintaining accounts receivable balances for accounts within his/her specific remits within terms and within credit limits through timely cash collection, including processing of documentary letters of credit. Ensuring issue of reminder letters to coincide with agreed customer settlement terms.
5.Maintaining up to date files by customer regarding actions taken to recover outstanding debts.
6.To ensure correct allocation of cash, invoices, credit notes and journals to maintain a reconciled accounts receivable.
7.Provide monthly data regarding accounts receivable condition 
8.Provide day to day credit support to relevant Outdoor sales divisions within set credit policy, to assist good communications and service excellence to customers.
9.Proactively review all pre-book/seasonal orders.
10.Prepare documentation for trade debt litigation for Credit Control Team Leader and/or Credit Manager, review and subsequent communication with solicitors to maintain up to date legal actions and files.
11.Attend review meetings with Credit Director Outdoor Coalition and relevant Credit Control Team Leader or Credit Manager, Outdoor Sales Management and Account Co-ordinators.  
12.Any other duties as assigned to the Job Holder within the Job Holder's capabilities.
13.Establish control-related standards and procedures
profile_positions.title: Credit Controller

profile_positions.description:
- Assessing eligibility of the applicants for a range of online Master and PHD programs offered by the University of Liverpool 
- Guiding qualified applicants through enrolment process for the respective programs 
- Prepare and maintain progress, conversion and related reports on a weekly, monthly and quarterly basis
- Liaising with the Registrar, the Admission Department and Academic Officers to ensure an excellent student experience
- Mentoring new staff as well as providing the team and sales department at various location with good practice sessions
- August 2011 – December 2012 – Team Leader

Projects and achievements:
- Creating and leading multiple webinar sessions held for Middle East region, covering general online education issues and to program specific areas 
- January 2013 – Setting up a new enrolment office (target: 300 employees) in Gdansk, Poland. Outside of my core tasks I was involved in daily training of soft skills and setting up good practice skills across new teams. In addition, I shared the product knowledge during individual and team sessions and supported newly appointed managers. I was also a liaison between new hires in Gdansk and their mentors in Amsterdam.
profile_positions.title: Senior Enrolment Advisor - Middle East IT specialist

profile_positions.description:
January 2007 – August 2008 Cash supervisor & ML Officer
 First point of contact with personal customers in a busy Dublin area branch: cash, check and draft transactions; advising on new products and services including personal loans, credit cards, short and long term deposit accounts as well as Internet Banking.
 As cash supervisor, individually run back office including Euro and foreign exchange cash management; supervise 4 front office tellers including cash best operational practices and balancing their accounts on the daily basis; cash & coin order and remittance for branch and B2B customers; cooperating with foreign exchange officer in weekly currency order and balancing sheet
 As ML Officer, providing anti-money laundering trainings for staff involved in cash handling, cooperating with ML department in cases of minor cash fraud within the branch operation, reporting to ML Manager in cases of suspicious transactions or account operations of branch customer.
Project and achievements:
 Q1 2007 – a member of team for the Internet Banking launch across Dublin branches; assisting customer is netting their online banking profiles, helping in first transactions, changing the perception of online banking among traditionally oriented customers
 2007-2008 – involved in introduction of SEPA: consultations and trainings for staff involved in foreign exchange processes
profile_positions.title: Cash supervisor
